lead_paragraph: A study in Colorado showed double the reports at above 8,000 feet. But the absolute risk of the condition remains “very low,” a doctor says.

headline.print_headline: SIDS Increases as Altitude Rises, a Report Says
headline.main: Living at High Altitude Is Linked to Higher SIDS Risk

snippet: A study in Colorado showed double the reports at above 8,000 feet. But the absolute risk of the condition remains “very low,” a doctor says.
abstract: Dr David F Katz study in journal Pediatrics concludes living at high altitude raises risk of sudden infant death syndrome.
